Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: ஒண்பொருள் காழ்ப்ப இயற்றியார்க்கு எண்பொருள் ஏனை இரண்டும் ஒருங்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: To those who have honestly acquired an abundance of riches, the other two, (virtue and pleasure) are things easy (of acquisition).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person has successfully and virtuously acquired a great deal of wealth, represented by a large, magnificent, fruit-bearing golden tree that they have cultivated ('ஒண்பொருள் காழ்ப்ப இயற்றி').
Layered_Composition.Midground: Because they have this solid foundation of wealth, the other two great goals of life, Virtue ('அறன்') and Pleasure ('இன்பம்'), are shown to be easily obtainable.
Layered_Composition.Background: Virtue is depicted as a path to a beautiful temple that is now easy to walk. Pleasure is depicted as a beautiful, flowing river that is now easy to access. Both are effortlessly within reach ('எண்பொருள்') because of the wealth-tree.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: For those who have made abundant and excellent wealth, the other two pursuits of life, virtue and pleasure, become easy to attain.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The golden wealth-tree is the foundation. The now-easy paths to the temple of Virtue and the river of Pleasure show how wealth makes them accessible.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Complete, fulfilled, effortless, a balanced life.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A bright, warm, golden light from the tree illuminates the entire scene, making all paths clear. The colors are rich and suggest a complete and prosperous life.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A wide, panoramic shot that shows the central wealth-tree and the two easy paths to virtue and pleasure it opens up.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Golden-hour lighting, symbolizing a life of fulfillment.

Cultural_Anchors: Makes Virtue and Pleasure easy ('ஏனை இரண்டும் எண்பொருள்')
The triad of Aram, Porul, Inbam (Virtue, Wealth, Pleasure).
